SEARCH
Package se.idsec.signservice.security.sign.impl

Class StaticCredentials

java.lang.Object
se.idsec.signservice.security.sign.impl.StaticCredentials
public class StaticCredentials extends Object
Utility class that holds pre-generated key pairs.

Mainly useful for testing, but also when to-be-signed bytes are calculated.

Author:
Martin Lindstr√∂m (martin@idsec.se), Stefan Santesson (stefan@idsec.se)

  • Constructor Details

    • StaticCredentials

      public StaticCredentials()
      Constructor.

    • StaticCredentials

      public StaticCredentials(int rsaKeySize, String ecCurve)
      Constructor setting the key size for RSA and curve for EC to use.
      Parameters:
      rsaKeySize - RSA key size in bits (default is 2048)
      ecCurve - identifier for EC curve to use (default is "P-256")

  • Method Details

    • getSigningCredential

      public se.swedenconnect.security.credential.PkiCredential getSigningCredential(String algorithmUri) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
      Returns a PkiCredential that can be used to sign using the supplied algorithm.
      Parameters:
      algorithmUri - the signature algorithm URI
      Returns:
      a PkiCredential instance
      Throws:
      NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the supplied algorithm is not supported

    • getRsaKeyPair

      public KeyPair getRsaKeyPair() throws InvalidParameterException
      Gets the generated RSA key pair.
      Returns:
      the RSA key pair.
      Throws:
      InvalidParameterException - if the keysize is incorrect

    • getEcKeyPair

      public KeyPair getEcKeyPair() throws InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
      Gets the generated EC key pair.
      Returns:
      the EC key pair
      Throws:
      InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - for unsupported curve

    • setAlgorithmRegistry

      public void setAlgorithmRegistry(se.swedenconnect.security.algorithms.AlgorithmRegistry algorithmRegistry)
      Assigns the AlgorithmRegistry to use. If not assigned, the registry configured for AlgorithmRegistrySingleton will be used.
      Parameters:
      algorithmRegistry - the registry to use
